name: Joon Health
headline: Pediatric digital therapeutic for the +100M families in the US
description:
Joon is an integrated pediatric digital health platform for kids, starting with behavior disorders like ADHD, autism, anxiety, and depression. In Joon, kids access a game-based digital therapeutic where they level up when they do real-life behaviors that are managed by parents and clinicians. 

Over the next 10 years, we plan on being the first-line vertically integrated digital treatment for pediatric behavior disorders, leveraging the first of its kind technology to drive behavior change.

founders.name: Isaac Eaves, Founder
founders.description: Isaac Eaves is the co-founder and CEO of Joon which he started with Brad Brenner and Kevin Bunarjo in 2021. Isaac focuses on managing the product and strategy of Joon. Having ADHD and having spent 10,000+ hours playing games as a kid, he's passionate about creating a game that kids love, but that also helps them achieve their potential in real-life. Isaac earned degrees in Computer Science and Business Administration from UC Berkeley.

founders.name: Brad Brenner, Founder
founders.description: Brad Brenner is the co-founder and Chief Operating Officer of Joon, which he started with Isaac Eaves and Kevin Bunarjo in 2021. Brad kicked off his entrepreneurial journey at the age of 7 and has started 4 businesses prior to Joon. At Joon, he takes point on all things operational from product development, user research, growth & marketing to financial planning and forecasting. Originally from Romania, Brad graduated from UC Berkeley with a degree in Business Administration.

founders.name: Kevin Bunarjo, Founder
founders.description: Kevin Bunarjo is an engineer at Joon. As a kid, Kevin spent countless hours playing video games (Minecraft, Runescape, Pokemon, Tetris being the top games) and hopes he can use Joon to leverage the fun of games to motivate kids to be productive in real life. Kevin graduated from UC Berkeley with degrees in Computer Science and Business Administration. Although he lives in the Bay Area now, he is originally from Jakarta, Indonesia.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Joon Health**

Founded in 2021 and hailing from the vibrant tech hub of San Francisco, Joon Health is set on a mission to revolutionize pediatric behavioral healthcare for over 100 million families across the U.S. Initially part of Y Combinator’s Winter 2022 cohort, Joon has quickly carved its niche as an integrated digital health platform tailored for children grappling with behavioral disorders such as ADHD, autism, anxiety, and depression.

**What is Joon Health?**

At its core, Joon is a game-based digital therapeutic platform that empowers children to engage in real-life behavioral improvements. Kids earn points and level up in a game while their progress is monitored by both parents and clinicians. This gamification of therapy not only makes the process enjoyable for kids but also fosters a collaborative approach involving caregivers.

**Vision for the Future**

Over the next decade, Joon envisions becoming the go-to digital treatment solution for pediatric behavioral disorders. They’re leveraging a first-of-its-kind technology designed to drive significant behavioral change and enhance treatment adherence.

**Current Features and Offerings**

Joon Health equips families with a variety of resources aimed at enhancing parental engagement and overall treatment effectiveness, including:

- **Parent Resource Library**: Access to over 100 training materials to guide caregivers.
- **Data Collection Mobile App**: A user-friendly platform for parents to log behaviors conveniently.
- **Goal Tracking**: Automated tools for monitoring progress toward specific treatment goals.
- **Token Economy System**: A setup that encourages children through rewards for positive behaviors.
- **AI Session Notes**: Automated note-taking to streamline communication between clinicians and families.
- **Free AI Tools**: Resources that save clinicians time on administrative tasks.

These features are rooted in evidence-based methodologies and aim to reinforce the vital role parents play in their child’s treatment journey.

**Why Joon Health Matters**

The platform addresses a pressing problem in clinical settings—parent adherence to treatment protocols. By directly involving parents through intuitive tools and real-time data collection, Joon enhances treatment integrity and accountability. Clinicians can monitor progress more effectively, ultimately leading to better patient outcomes.

**Feedback from Clinicians and Families**

Clinicians are lauding Joon for its ability to bridge the gap between them and the families they serve. Parents, on the other hand, have found the platform transformative—turning what was once an overwhelming process into an engaging experience that children look forward to.

**Conclusion**

Joon Health is on a mission to fundamentally change how pediatric behavioral health is managed—transforming consultations into collaborations that genuinely involve families. If you're a parent navigating these challenges or a clinician looking to integrate a modern solution into your practice, Joon might just be what you need to level up your approach.

Curious to dive deeper? Check out their website at [Joon Health](https://joonhealth.co).
